org.openadaptor.auxil.connector.jdbc.writer
Interface ISQLWriter

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractSQLWriter
public interface ISQLWriter

Interface for classes which write records to JDBC databases.

Since:
3.2.2
Author:
higginse
See Also:
JDBCWriteConnector

Method Summary
 boolean hasBatchSupport()
          Returns true if the connection has batchSupport, and the writer can also support batch writes.

          validate the state of the writer.

Method Detail

initialise

public void initialise(java.sql.Connection connection)
                throws ConnectionException
Initialise writer with given JDBC Connection object.

Parameters:
connection - Connection which the writer should use.
Throws:
ConnectionException - If there is any problem using the Connection

hasBatchSupport

public boolean hasBatchSupport()
Returns true if the connection has batchSupport, and the writer can also support batch writes.

Returns:
true batch updates are supported

writeBatch

public void writeBatch(java.lang.Object[] dataBatch)
                throws java.sql.SQLException
Write a batch of records to a database. If the writer can allows batch writes, it will attempt to write all records in a single batch. Otherwise, it will perform successive writes, one for each record in the batch.

Parameters:
dataBatch - Object[] containing records to be written.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException

validate

public void validate(java.util.List exceptions,
                     IComponent comp)
validate the state of the writer.

Parameters:
exceptions - list of validation exceptions to append to.
comp -
